channel.title: Zip on warrick.io
channel.description: Recent content in Zip on warrick.io

item.title: Python unzip idiom
item.description: The *splat operator is commonly used to unzip arrays in Python: >>> a = [1,2,3] >>> b = [4,5,6] >>> zip(a,b) [(1, 4), (2, 5), (3, 6)] >>> zip(*_) [(1, 2, 3), (4, 5, 6)] I’ve included another trick, the _ (underscore) is a shortcut in the interactive interpreter for the last returned value, which works in irb too and likely many others.
